metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0835 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 36.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-globalmenu - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-testsuite - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Christian Holler, Gary Kwong, Jesse Ruderman, Byron Campen, Randell Jesup, Robin Whittleton, Jon Coppeard, and Nikhil Marathe

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
